intro: Hieracium micantiramum, commonly known as the silverleaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are hairy and often silver-gray in color, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
